page.title: 08FAMILY LIFE IN MIDDLETON
page.content: On Saturday, people get up between 6.30 and 10.30. Breakfast varies from cereal and toast to sausage, bacon and egg. After breakfast children watch "The Picture Show" on T.V. Their parents tidy the house or do some gardening. Some children have badminton, swimming or music lessons. Lunch is usually a light snack; sausage rolls, sandwiches, soup or a take-away. If shopping in Manchester, they might eat at MacDonald's fast food restaurant. Parents go shopping after lunch; children either accompany them or play games like hide-and-seek, tig, roller-skating and riding bikes. Tea is usually a roast meat or salad. Drinks range from tea and coffee to coke. Afterwards most families watch T.V. while others play games or read. Bedtime falls between 9.00 and 11.00 p.m.
